intro: Pemphis madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar pemphis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
